author: Ian Anderson
title: What happens in your brain when you fall in love? - video | Life and style
text:
What happens in your brain when you fall in love? - video 
Butterflies in your stomach or neurotransmitters on overdrive – science suggests there’s more to romance than our Valentine’s cards would have us believe. So, what’s dopamine got to do with it?
Supported by About this content   View more sharing options   Close Ian Anderson , Tim Foster and Richard Vine , theguardian.com
Tuesday 14 February 2017 08.00 GMT 
Relationships Brain waves Valentine's Day Biology
